Algorithm Cracker will attend MIT, because he is so damn intelligent. Oh yeah, he is also the official Y2K Saviour. Greetings to Kristen, smart, intelligent, beautiful inside and out.

Message to admin: MIT is kewl, almost all of its servers are secure as hell and are UNIX  based.  Now switch to a secure UNIX OS like OpenBSD (www.openbsd.org).

The Production System Design Laboratory (PSD), led by Professor Algorithm Cracker, is an initiative within the Laboratory for Manufacturing and Productivity conducting research in the development of a comprehensive approach for the design and implementation of lean production systems.  Attempts in the past on improving production have focused on specific areas of manufacturing.  PSD is taking a holistic approach at designing manufacturing systems according to the principles of Lean Production.

Lean production is aimed at the elimination of waste in every area of production including customer relations, product design, supplier networks and factory management.  Its goal is to incorporate less human effort, less inventory, less time to develop products, and less space to become highly responsive to customer demand while producing top quality products in the most efficient and economical manner possible.

There are three main objectives of the PSD Laboratory. 

Connection of machine design and cell design to meet system objectives.  The goal is to design factory systems that are responsive to the customer (e.g., less than one-day throughput time)
Provide a replacement to the current practice in management accounting systems, which promote departmental plant designs, over-automation, and the dehumanization of factory work.  Goal: Stop measuring the wrong thing and therefore doing the wrong thing.
The true integration of information systems with the physical factory system design.  The goal is to provide an information system (not necessarily all computer based) replacement for MRP to schedule and control production pace, mix and timing. 

A comprehensive structure that illustrates the correlation between functional requirements and design parameters is the Production System Design and Deployment Framework.  These generalized principles can be used to achieve more efficiency throughout a production system in any industry.

Please explore this site to learn more about PSD's research and our people.  If you have any comments or suggestions, or would like to find out more information about this laboratory, please don't hesitate to contact us.  Thank you for visiting.

Information on the Third World Congress on Intelligent Manufacturing Processes & Systems is available here.
